name: Plaza Mayor
address: Historic Center, Villa de Leyva, Boyacá, Colombia
description: The main square of Villa de Leyva, one of the largest in the Americas, fully cobbled and surrounded by colonial architecture.

name: Casa Terracota
address: Monquirá village, 10 minutes from downtown Villa de Leyva
description: A house entirely built out of baked clay, considered the largest piece of pottery in the world.

name: El Fósil Museum
address: Km 5 on the road to Santa Sofía, Villa de Leyva, Boyacá
description: Paleontological museum housing a fossil of a Kronosaurus over 120 million years old, among other prehistoric findings.

name: El Infiernito (Monquirá Archaeological Site)
address: Monquirá village, 6 km from Villa de Leyva
description: An ancient Muisca archaeological site with stone monoliths and a pre-Columbian astronomical observatory.

name: Iguaque Lagoon
address: Iguaque Flora and Fauna Sanctuary, road from Villa de Leyva to Arcabuco
description: A sacred Muisca lagoon located in the páramo; accessible through an ecological hike in a protected natural area.

name: Pozos Azules
address: Monquirá village, 3 km from downtown Villa de Leyva
description: A group of artificial turquoise-colored ponds created by mineral filtration and former mining activity.

name: Antonio Nariño House Museum
address: Carrera 9 No. 10-25, Villa de Leyva, Boyacá
description: Museum located in the house where independence leader Antonio Nariño lived, showcasing documents and artifacts.

name: Museum of El Carmen
address: Calle 13 and Carrera 10, Villa de Leyva, near the main square
description: A church and religious art museum with an important collection of colonial religious paintings and sculptures.
